特記事項: 本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法:
In principle, this class will be face-to-face; however, all class materials, tasks, and explanations will be posted in a Google Classroom dedicated to this class.

Depending on enrollment and the evolving COVID-19 situation, course format may include the following:
- Individual, pair, and group discussion based on topics that relate to content
- Sharing of information, including weekly homework assignments, on Google Classroom- Presentation and homework assignments
- All components conducted in English
- As a level 2 course, all English tasks expected to be completed at an upper-intermediate level

第1回:
**The schedule below is an example of what the course will look like. Specific contents will not be decided upon until after a needs analysis is done (during first class) to determine the interests, backgrounds, and needs of enrolled students**

Week 1: Class overview, introductions, ice breakers

In principle, all 14 sessions will be conducted face to face
Needs Analysis Survey: 1 hour
第2回: Week 2: Introduction to culture, discuss first 250-word journal

Each class, students will need to submit a 250-word journal based on discussion questions related to the topic.
Journal 1: 1-2 hours
第3回: Week 3: Etiquette and how it differs across cultures; discuss second 250-word journal
第4回: Week 4: Nonverbal communication across cultures: how to avoid misunderstandings; discuss third 250-word journal
第5回: Week 5: The role of media in perpetuating stereotypes, prejudice, and discrimination; discuss fourth 250-word journal
第6回: Week 6: TV programs and how they may change one’s perspective about culture; discuss fifth 250-word journal
第7回: Week 7: Considering culture via the describe, interpret, evaluate (DIE) activity; discuss sixth 250-word journal
第8回: Week 8: Canada, its people, and its culture. Is it possible to define? Role of media?; discuss seventh 250-word journal
第9回: Week 9: How is Japan depicted in the media: a look at Mr. Sparkle and The Simpsons; discuss eighth 250-word journal
第10回: Week 10: What causes media to go viral across borders?; discuss ninth 250-word journal
第11回: Week 11: The university experience - comparing the lives of Japanese and Canadian students; short practice presentation; discuss final 250-word journal

成績評価Grading0: 評価基準等　Grading Criteria etc.
成績評価Grading2: Weekly Journal writing and vocab building, 10 @ 3% each
